title: DC for resolution public complaints under ‘open door policy’
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):The Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) administration has introduced an open door policy, making it easier for citizens to have their concerns heard and resolved quickly.
Under the new open door policy, citizens are encouraged to visit the District Commissioner’s office in Islamabad during office hours with any concerns or complaints, said the spokesman of ICT administration.
On the occasion, Deputy Commissioner (DC) Islamabad, Irfan Nawaz Memon has assured that issues brought forward by citizens would be addressed on the spot.
This policy is now in effect across all district administration offices in Islamabad.
The DC emphasized that action would be taken against any officials who fail to attend to citizens’ concerns during office hours. Irfan Nawaz has also encouraged citizens to visit these offices without needing any references or connections. With the doors of the district administration offices open, citizens could now expect their grievances to be heard and resolved promptly.
